name: NSBackgroundActivityScheduler
desc: A task scheduler suitable for low priority operations that can run in the background.

items.name: identifier
items.desc: A unique reverse DNS notation string, such as com.example.MyApp.updatecheck, that identifies the activity.

items.name: repeats
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the activity should be rescheduled after it completes.

items.name: interval
items.desc: An integer providing a suggested interval between scheduling and invoking the activity.

items.name: qualityOfService
items.desc: A value of type NSQualityOfService, which controls how aggressively the system schedules the activity.

items.name: shouldDefer
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether your app should stop performing background activity and resume at a more optimal time.

items.name: tolerance
items.desc: A value of type TimeInterval, which specifies a range of time during which the background activity may occur.

items.name: invalidate
items.desc: Prevents the background activity from being scheduled again.

items.name: NSBackgroundActivityScheduler.Result
items.desc: These constants indicate whether background activity has been completed successfully or whether additional processing should be deferred until a more optimal time.

items.name: QualityOfService
items.desc: Used to indicate the nature and importance of work to the system. Work with higher quality of service classes receive more resources than work with lower quality of service classes whenever there is resource contention.

items.name: s ProcessInfo
items.desc: A collection of information about the current process.
